result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter requesting continuance, Defense, state has no objection
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:28 AM Defendant Savion T Grant in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Arthur August Baranowski in court for Savion T Grant.  Attorney Kyle Olson Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. 

IN CUSTODY
Re: Defense motion to reduce bail. Argument in support of motion by Atty Baranowski. Argument in opposition by ADA Olson.
Court makes ruling and will not make a bail change at this time.

10:26 AM Defendant Savion T Grant in court, in custody. Attorney Robert Arthur August Baranowski in court for Savion T Grant.  Attorney Kyle Olson for Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. 

IN CUSTODY
Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Arraignment and status set for 9/26 rescheduled by the court.
Arraignment on August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. Det. J McDermott, MAPD, duly sworn & testified. Direct exam by ADA Nelson. Witness ID'd DE. No cross. Witness excused. No further witnesses.
